result.execSummary:
The defendant Shavonta L. Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shavonta L. Simpson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shavonta L. Simpson was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Satisfaction Mailed, Fee UNPAID ($5.00)
Ct. 1
AMENDED  -  $10.00 DRGOD surcharge was omitted.
Ct. 2
30 days to pay or civil judgment

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Shavonta L. Simpson, appeared with Attorney Aileen G. Henry.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Count 1 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft. is sentenced to 30 days in the KCJ commencing on 1/31/15 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Court costs & surcharge ordered and is due in 30 days or Civil Judgment.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Shavonta L. Simpson, appeared with Attorney Aileen G. Henry.  Clerk: PT
Defendant appears late and is now present in court.  Court vacates bench warrant (not yet issued) and resinstates bond.  Atty Henry requests one final adjournment for a plea & sentencing; no objection by the State.  Plea & Sentencing on 1/15/15 at 11:30 AM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Attorney Aileen G. Henry appeared on behalf of defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Defendant fails to appear in court.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $5000 Cash Bond and prior bond shall be forfeited.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Shavonta L. Simpson, appeared with Attorney Aileen G. Henry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Henry states a counter proposal was given to the State and requests an adjournment as she expects case to be resolved.  FPT on 11/18/14 at 10:10 AM.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Aileen Henry. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Henry. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 10-30-14 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.

to Preliminary Hearing

Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2014 at 08:45 am.
